title: At Home Among Strangers, a Stranger Among His Own

sources.title: At Home Among Strangers, a Stranger Among His Own
sources.description:
The civil war has recently ended, the country is devastated and hungry, Russia needs bread. It can only be bought abroad with gold. The party committee from Siberia sends a valuable cargo to Moscow, which is entrusted to accompany a group of Chekists. However, a group of bandits rob the gold train and kill the escorts. But one of them remains alive - and becomes a victim of the suspicion of betrayal. Now he must return the gold to prove his innocence.

IMDb rating: 7,4

Year of production: 1974

Director: Nikita Mikhalkov
Writers: Mikhalkov Nikita, Volodarsky Eduard
Composer: Artemyev Eduard
Operator: Lebeshev Pavel
Production designers: Shreter Irina, Adabashyan Alexander
Cast: Alexander Kalyagin, Sergey Shakurov, Nikita Mikhalkov, Nikolai Pastukhov, Konstantin Raikin, Anatoly Solonitsyn, Alexander Kaidanovsky, Yury Bogatyrev, Nikolay Zasukhin, Alexander Porokhovshchikov

The film was digitally restored by Mosfilm Cinema Concern
Find out more: https://cg.mosfilm.ru/en

metadata.Plot: The action of this psychological film takes place in the 1920s in a small provincial town in southern Russia. The civil war is over, but the Bolsheviks are still far from complete victory. A group of gangsters of former white officers rob a train of gold, which needed to buy bread for the hungry, and five friends, former Red fighters, engage them in mortal combat.
metadata.Actors: Yuriy Bogatyryov, Anatoliy Solonitsyn, Sergey Shakurov
